page.shortlink: api objects request object get cookie method
page.description: Returns a cookie if the cookie exists.

argument.name: CookieName
argument.description: The name of the cookie to fetch.

return.name: Result
return.description: Returns a [System::Web::HttpCookie] object if the cookie exists, otherwise returns a null value.

page.discussion: *[xb:Context.Request.GetCookie]* returns a [System::Web::HttpCookie] object if the cookie exists. If the cookie does not exist, *[xb:Context.Request.GetCookie]* returns a null value.

section.example:
dim cookieName as c = "myCookie"
cookie = Context.Request.GetCookie(cookieName)
'test the cookie for a null value. if (cookie == null_value()) then ? "Cookie does not exist!" else ? cookie.Name + " has a value of " + cookie.Value end if

section.description: In addition to using the [null_value()] method, you can alternatively compare the type of the variable returned by *[xb:Context.Request.GetCookie]* to "Z", the null data type:
section.example: if (typeof(cookie) == "Z") then ? "Cookie does not exist!" end if
